intro: Monelasmum glomeratum, commonly known as the clustered monelasmum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with compound leaves and pea-like flowers that range in color from white to purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native region.
